alert.note: Alert for Grand (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 29 at 6:03AM MDT until May 31 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding of low lying areas caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Along the Colorado River upstream of Shadow Mountain Lake. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 559 AM MDT, River gauges report high flows on the Colorado River above Shadow Mountain Lake and north of Grand Lake. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include...along the Colorado River above Shadow Mountain Lake and north of Grand Lake.
info.instruction: Excessive runoff from snowmelt will cause flooding of low lying areas along the Colorado River above Shadow Mountain Lake and north of Grand Lake.
